title: Phishing Email from Your Bank
description: A phishing email that looks like it’s from your bank, asking you to verify your account by clicking on a suspicious link.
tips: Don’t click on links in unsolicited emails and verify the sender’s email address.

title: Fake Investment Opportunity
description: A scam promising high returns with no risk, usually related to fake cryptocurrency or stock market opportunities.
tips: Be cautious of unsolicited investment offers and never share financial information with unverified sources.

title: Fake Online Love Interest
description: A scam where a person pretends to fall in love with you online and later asks for money or personal information.
tips: Avoid sending money to someone you've just met online, and look for red flags like requests for financial help.

title: Fake Job Offer for a Remote Position
description: A fake job offer that promises high-paying remote work but requires you to pay for training or software before you can start.
tips: Legitimate employers never ask for money upfront. Always research companies before accepting offers.

title: Fake Charity Scam
description: A scammer pretends to be from a charity, especially after a natural disaster, asking for donations to support victims.
tips: Verify the legitimacy of charities through official channels before donating.

title: Tech Support Scareware
description: A pop-up message appears on your screen claiming your computer has a virus and prompts you to call a tech support number.
tips: Don’t call the number on the pop-up. Close the window and run a legitimate antivirus program.
